column6: passed away at 1:05 p. m. on saturday
column11: he was the son of raphael and elsie mae (hughes) breeden. he was a self employed cattle farmer who also served his country in the korean war with the united states army. he was a member of the bloomfield american legion post 196. he enjoyed watching iu basketball
column13: and loved to mushroom hunt. surviving relatives include: his wife
column14: betty (taylor) breeden whom he married september 21
column19: judy purcell (tim) and joyce carmichael (troy) all of bloomfield; one brother
column20: harlan breeden of bloomington; eleven grandchildren
column21: ten great grandchildren and one great grandson on the way. he was preceded in death by one daughter
column26: gladys keller and juanita strahle and his parents. funeral services will be conducted at 1:00 p. m. on tuesday
column28: 2015 at jenkins funeral home in bloomfield
column29: with rev. arlen pope officiating. interment will follow in greene county chapel cemetery in rural solsberry. public visitation will be held from 10:00 a. m. tuesday until the hour of services at the funeral home. the family asks that all memorial donations be made to iu health hospice. online condolences to the family are available at www. jenkinsfuneralhomes. com. upcoming events. visitationjun 23. 10:00 am - 1:00 pm lester jenkins and sons funeral home inc. - bloomfield421 south seminary street. bloomfield
